TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VocabularySearchHelper extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents an API set to create URLs that will handle HTTP GET queries for searches on a specified vocabulary.
Docs.remarks: The urls provide a means for browser based access to the vocabulary search in HealthVault. The response is returned in JSON format.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Uri CreateVocabularySearchRequestJsonAuthenticatedUrl (Microsoft.Health.VocabularySearchParameters searchParameters, string jsonCallbackName, int timeToLiveMinutes);

.method public static hidebysig class System.Uri CreateVocabularySearchRequestJsonAuthenticatedUrl(class Microsoft.Health.VocabularySearchParameters searchParameters, string jsonCallbackName, int32 timeToLiveMinutes) cil managed

Docs.param: The set of parameters that identify the vocabulary to search, maximum search results, the culture etc.
This is the name of the callback function that will be called to parse the JSON response.
The amount of time in minutes that the URL will be valid for.
Docs.summary: Creates a vocabulary search request url in which the application is identified using the application certificate as the authentication parameter.
Docs.returns: A URL which can be used in the browser to make AJAX calls to HealthVault vocabulary search.
Docs.remarks: 1. This is an authenticated access mechanism for public and restricted vocabularies in HealthVault. 2. The call will require more processing on the HealthVault server and it is recommended, that this mechanism be used to mainly access restricted vocabularies in HealthVault that require authenticated access.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Uri CreateVocabularySearchRequestJsonUrl (Microsoft.Health.VocabularySearchParameters searchParameters, string jsonCallbackName, Guid serviceToken);

.method public static hidebysig class System.Uri CreateVocabularySearchRequestJsonUrl(class Microsoft.Health.VocabularySearchParameters searchParameters, string jsonCallbackName, valuetype System.Guid serviceToken) cil managed

Docs.param: The set of parameters that identify the vocabulary to search, maximum search results, the culture, etc.
This is the name of the callback function that will be called to parse the JSON response.
A Guid token that is used to identify the application that is going to make the search call.
Docs.summary: Creates a vocabulary search request URL in which the application is identified using its service token.
Docs.returns: A URL which can be used in the browser to make AJAX calls to HealthVault vocabulary search.
Docs.remarks: 1. This is a fast access mechanism to publicly available vocabularies in HealthVault. 2. The service token is available at 3. Searches to restricted vocabularies that an application has access to will not succeed with this method. For those searches please use
